messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] seppuku
messages.msgSnippet: thanks guys! that surely will help my research... again thanks and god speed! ^o^ ... From: jore lehtinen  To:
messages.messageBody:
thanks guys! that surely will help my research... again thanks and god speed! ^o^

----- Original Message ----
From: jore lehtinen <tengu64@...>
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, June 1, 2007 5:11:34 PM
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] seppuku













if this count:sanada yukimura(at osaka summer campaing) was so tired that

when enemy soldier rush at him ,he merely took of his helmet and bowed...is

this close what you are looking for as enemy helped seppuku in the

battle?...Jore



>From: jonathan ellgen <jpellgen@yahoo. com>

>Reply-To: samuraihistory@ yahoogroups. com

>To: samuraihistory@ yahoogroups. com

>Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] seppuku

>Date: Thu, 31 May 2007 20:25:46 -0700 (PDT)

>

>That's an interesting question. I wrote my graduate thesis on seppuku and I

>am currently co-authoring a book on the subject. However, I haven't come

>across that scenario. Then again... I haven't been looking. Im intruiged

>though.

>

>Jonathan P. Ellgen

>

>reilly1221 <reilly1221@yahoo. com> wrote:

>hi guys, just want to know about something. in a samurai battle, was

> there ever an instance that a defeated samurai would ask an opponent

> to cut off his head when he is about to commit seppuku. all in the

> middle of a battle. Thanks! ^o^

>

>

>

>

>

>

>----------- --------- --------- ----

>Never miss an email again!

>Yahoo! Toolbar alerts you the instant new Mail arrives. Check it out.

>

>[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

>



____________ _________ _________ _________ _________ _________ _

Missä sinä rentoudut? Missä on parhaat bileet? Kerro meille

suosikkipaikkasi. http://loveeveryday .msn.com/ ?mkt=fi

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] seppuku
messages.msgSnippet: That s an interesting question. I wrote my graduate thesis on seppuku and I am currently co-authoring a book on the subject. However, I haven t come across
messages.messageBody:
That's an interesting question. I wrote my graduate thesis on seppuku and I am currently co-authoring a book on the subject. However, I haven't come across that scenario. Then again... I haven't been looking. Im intruiged though.

Jonathan P. Ellgen

reilly1221 <reilly1221@...> wrote: hi guys, just want to know about something. in a samurai battle, was
there ever an instance that a defeated samurai would ask an opponent
to cut off his head when he is about to commit seppuku. all in the
middle of a battle. Thanks! ^o^

messages.subject: seppuku
messages.msgSnippet: hi guys, just want to know about something. in a samurai battle, was there ever an instance that a defeated samurai would ask an opponent to    cut off his
messages.messageBody:
hi guys, just want to know about something. in a samurai battle, was
there ever an instance that a defeated samurai would ask an opponent
to cut off his head when he is about to commit seppuku. all in the
middle of a battle. Thanks! ^o^
